page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERNS.
page.content: The major concerns in Edington are the young,old and unemployed. Whilst very young,the children are catered for by school,home,country-side,Playfield, Brownies and Cubs.The trouble starts with the teenagers,many needing the type of entertainment only found in larger towns.Public transport is inadequate and expensive,and often parents do not have the time, or money to act as a taxi service!There is no Youth Club, and through boredom,a few are even law breaking. The community works hard for the elderly.A Friendly Circle meets each week,and has regular outings. There is a day centre with transport provided,in Bratton,1 mile away.A Good Neighbour scheme not only checks upon welfare,but is also available for more urgent transport problems.
